extends Controller
implements IDomesticTradeController, java.util.Observer

    • Constructor Detail

      • DomesticTradeController

        public DomesticTradeController(IDomesticTradeView tradeView,
                               IDomesticTradeOverlay tradeOverlay,
                               IWaitView waitOverlay,
                               IAcceptTradeOverlay acceptOverlay,
                               Facade facade)
        DomesticTradeController constructor
        Parameters:
        tradeView - Domestic trade view (i.e., view that contains the "Domestic Trade" button)
        tradeOverlay - Domestic trade overlay (i.e., view that lets the user propose a domestic trade)
        waitOverlay - Wait overlay used to notify the user they are waiting for another player to accept a trade
        acceptOverlay - Accept trade overlay which lets the user accept or reject a proposed trade

      • doneSelectingResources

        public boolean doneSelectingResources()
        This checks the total sending resources and total receiving resources to see if the user is done choosing the resources they want in the trade. this function is primarily used in the checkState() function
        Returns:
        boolean if the they're done selecting resources.

      • checkIfReadyToTrade

        public void checkIfReadyToTrade()
        Checks if the receiver is set and if the resources are done being selected If so, it lets the user send the trade. Called in the checkState() function.

      • checkState

        public void checkState()
        Checks if the user can send the trade. This function is called pretty much everytime something about a trade is changed.

      • getResources

        public void getResources(ResourceList offer)
        This function dissects a TradeOffer into the getAcceptOverlay() view so the user looking at it sees the correct offer
        Parameters:
        offer - a TradeOffer which the function dissects

      • update

        public void update(java.util.Observable o,
                   java.lang.Object arg)
        Specified by:
        update in interface java.util.Observer

      • showTradeModal

        public void showTradeModal(boolean canAccept,
                           GameModel gameModel)
        displays trade modal
        Parameters:
        canAccept - boolean that says whether or not the user can accept the trade being offered.
        gameModel - just the game model to be passed.

      • outputMaps

        public java.lang.String outputMaps()
        Simple function to return the current maps... used for debugging.
        Returns:
        String of the maps. "System.out.println(outputMaps());"
